hypothesis_content.title: Regulatory News Implied Volatility Spike Pattern
hypothesis_content.statement: Following major regulatory news (EU MiCA, US legislation, UK FCA rules), if BTC 1-day implied volatility spikes >50% but 30-day IV remains stable (<20% change), price will mean-revert to pre-news levels within 5 days and maintain NEUTRAL regime 80% of time.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Short-term IV spikes on regulatory news often overstate actual market impact when long-term IV remains anchored. News-driven gaps in NEUTRAL regimes tend to fill as structural regime drivers unchanged. Market overreacts to regulatory headlines.
entry_conditions: Major regulatory headline confirmed by 3+ news sources
BTC 1D IV spikes >50% from previous day

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 1% of pre-news level OR 5 days elapsed
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves >5% beyond initial gap direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Gaps on regulatory news with IV divergence pattern lead to sustained regime transitions >30% of time OR fail to mean-revert within 5 days
